name: Child of the First Poem 4
description:
A poem in five parts. After Rilke. First published in Stone Canoe. 

The first time we heard black holes
ready to collide, we found 
we could hear the red of wars
      and of spires too, could hear the steady
	passing of the centuries, could hear

the cries, guttural and whimper
the cries, a bed of pine,
the dogs of war,
	bearing down on our sun.
